direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods involve setting or retrieving the title of the document, with similar control flow and state management.
Both methods interact with the document's head element, albeit for different purposes (title vs. head element manipulation).
Both methods create or manipulate elements within the document, though for different purposes (title vs. generic element creation).
Both methods handle text content within the document, potentially sharing similar exception handling mechanisms.
Both methods involve setting or retrieving document-level properties (title vs. charset), potentially accessing similar resources.
Both methods modify the document's state, albeit for different purposes (title vs. meta charset element).

enhanced_by.reason: The head() method is used to set up the document's head element, which is necessary before setting or retrieving the title.
The title(String) method must be invoked to set the document's title, which is a state dependency for the title() method.
Both methods verify the format of text content within the document, sharing similar exception handling mechanisms.
